title: Serif font — Richard Rodney Bennett: Impromptus
content:
Hello,  
wondering what this font is called?  
Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132039im_/http:/typophile.com/files/azsdf_5231.jpg)

Font: 

 Elegante Roman 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132039/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: Emma-L

comments.content:
Closest match I could find is Elegante Roman, but unless I'm mistaken the M in your sample has sloping sides:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/elegante/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132039/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/elegante/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/elegante/")
